block.p: Julia Yve Weil, the daughter of Shelia and Wayne Weil of Rutherford, N.J., and Jeffrey Todd Lazarus, a son of Arlene and Steven Lazarus of Glencoe, Ill., are to be married tonight at Wave Hill in the Bronx. Judge Loretta A. Preska of the Federal District Court for the Southern District of New York is to officiate.
The couple graduated magna cum laude from Dartmouth College, where they met.

Julia Yve Weil, the daughter of Shelia and Wayne Weil of Rutherford, N.J., and Jeffrey Todd Lazarus, a son of Arlene and Steven Lazarus of Glencoe, Ill., are to be married tonight at Wave Hill in the Bronx. Judge Loretta A. Preska of the Federal District Court for the Southern District of New York is to officiate.
The couple graduated magna cum laude from Dartmouth College, where they met.

The bride, 32, is the special assistant to the president of the American Museum of Natural History in Manhattan. Her father is the art director of Dartmouth Graphics in Manhattan. Her mother is the executive assistant for Beauchamp Place Communications, a developer of cable television networks, in Manhattan.

The bridegroom, 34, is a founder and the chief operating officer of Realtime Music Solutions, a music technology company in Manhattan. His father is the founding general partner in Arch Venture Partners, a venture capital company in Chicago. The bridegroom's mother is a travel consultant with Bannockburn Travel in Bannockburn, Ill.
